title: Man charged with motor vehicle homicide in Pittsfield hit and run that saw victim dragged 4 miles, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Gross, 65, charged with motor vehicle homicide for a hit-and-run in Pittsfield, killing William Colbert, 69.
Colbert was struck at Linden Street and Francis Avenue intersection, then dragged four miles to near a Best Western Hotel.
Gross arrested after investigation, charged with leaving the scene, and arraignment set for Wednesday in Central Berkshire District Court.

title: Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Here’s how to apply.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: The Massachusetts RMV is holding a lottery for low-number commemorative license plates for the state's 250th anniversary.
Eligible Massachusetts residents can apply online for free between February 16 and April 17, 2026.
Winners will be announced in early May and will pay a $60 registration and $40 specialty fee.

title: Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts introduces ChatGPT AI assistant for nearly 40,000 state employees, first implementation of its kind in the US.
AI assistant deployment will start with the Executive Office of Technology Services and Security, followed by other agencies.
Concerns raised by the National Association of Government Employees about job impact and rushed implementation of AI.

title: Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Garlock Flexibles will close two Gardner, MA locations, eliminating 91 jobs by the end of September.
The 164 Fredette St. and 77 Industrial Rowe facilities will shut down, with limited administrative roles remaining.
Garlock Flexibles, acquired by Astara Capital Partners in 2021, provides packaging solutions for the food and retail sectors.

title: Assailant in Pawtucket hockey rink shooting killed ex-wife and son, police confirm
author: Abby Patkin and Molly Farrar
bullets: Robert Dorgan, who also used the name Roberta Esposito, fatally shot his ex-wife Rhonda and son Aidan Dorgan in Pawtucket.
Three additional victims, including Rhonda's parents and a family friend, were critically injured in the Dennis M. Lynch Arena shooting.
Dorgan legally purchased the firearms, and police continue to investigate motives, including reviewing social media and game footage.

title: Boston’s Vietnamese community celebrates Tết with culture and tradition
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Boston's Vietnamese community celebrated Tết at the Menino Convention & Exhibition Center in South Boston.
The festival included traditional Vietnamese arts, like calligraphy, and cultural displays such as Ao Dài dresses.
Organized by local Vietnamese associations, the event aimed to promote cultural unity and connection across generations.

title: How a New Jersey runner is turning the 2026 Boston Marathon into a personal mission
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Kevin Brutus, 30, from Guttenberg, NJ, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon following his father's death from a stroke.
Brutus aims to honor his father by running with Tedy’s Team, which focuses on heart disease and stroke awareness.
This will be Brutus's 10th marathon and his fifth World Marathon Major, making it a significant personal milestone.

title: His future wife survived a medical emergency thanks to Boston MedFlight
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Sean Largay is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to fundraise for Boston MedFlight.
His future wife, Maggie Bea, was saved by Boston MedFlight during a 2024 medical emergency.
Largay expresses profound respect for medical professionals despite not being in the field himself.

title: He’s running the Boston Marathon to support young athletes
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ahmed Mansour, 45, from Houston, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support the Boston Athletic Academy.
Mansour's marathon mission aims to help underprivileged youth gain access to mentorship, education, and athletics.
Boston will be Mansour's 6th World Marathon Major star; he plans to run in Sydney next.

title: American Eagle Outfitters to close Devens distribution facility, cutting 103 jobs
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: American Eagle Outfitters is closing a distribution facility in Devens, Massachusetts, leading to 103 job cuts.
Layoffs at the Devens facility will begin on April 12 as part of a strategy to restructure logistics.
The closure follows American Eagle's purchase of Quiet Logistics for $360 million in 2021 to enhance supply chain operations.
